long: Meaning: to "bear young"; causatively, to "beget"; medically, to "act as midwife"; specifically, to "show lineage".  Usage: bear, beget, birth(-day), born, (make to) bring forth (children, young), bring up, calve, child, come, be delivered (of a child), time of delivery, gender, hatch, labour, (do the office of a) midwife, declare pedigrees, be the son of, (woman in, woman that) travail(-eth, -ing woman).  Source: a primitive root;
